intro: Bellis hybrida, commonly known as the daisy or English daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its white petals surrounding a yellow center, forming a classic daisy-like flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal rosettes of spoon-shaped leaves. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, lawns, and along roadsides. Bellis hybrida is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
